summary: Today marked a psychological inflection point in Quant prep. A shift from external app-dependence to building a personalized, distraction-free, system-driven strategy. Clear rejection of dopamine-based platforms in favor of self-coded structure. Emotional and cognitive alignment started syncing again, driven by the 'clear cutoff' goal, not perfectionism. Execution momentum is still low, but clarity is high.

wins: Clarified that apps like Unacademy/Testbook are traps unless used sniper-style
Reframed Quant prep into a system-builder identity (QCKS)
Defined lean syllabus that matches cognitive ROI: simplification, series, quadratics, basic DI, core arithmetic
losses: No quant drill was actually executed today — still in prep-the-prep loop
Past app-hopping behavior resurfaced as doubt while evaluating Unacademy
ideas: Build own offline Flutter app to log quant drills like SAM — same mental pattern reuse
Use JSONL logs to track quant prep as code not just effort — version control mindset
Design quant flashcards and Q-tracker with emotional triggers (e.g., 'I’m a clarity-hitter, not a syllabus-eater')

goals: Set up /quant-prep-qcks/ folder with logs, question sets, and tricks.md
Complete Day 1 drill: 20 simplification questions, log accuracy
Avoid opening Unacademy/Testbook without sniper-level intent
triggerEvents: Realized frustration with app clutter and lack of focused content
